intro: Anagallis mas, commonly known as the mouse-ear or devil's-bit scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring basal rosettes of lanceolate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pink or purple flowers that bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, sunny environments such as meadows and rocky soils. Anagallis mas is often found in disturbed habitats and is considered a characteristic species of certain grassland ecosystems.
